title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Introduction to Power systems Ã¢ÂÂ Generation, Transmission and distribution system. Single line diagram and per unit system. Restructuring of power utility and its implications.Power system components: Circuit model of synchronous generators and Transformers. Transmission lines Ã¢ÂÂ lumped and distributed parameter models.Steady state operation Ã¢ÂÂ Short, medium and long line models of transmission lines. ABCD parameters. Real and reactive power flow on a transmission line and line loadability.Power Flow Analysis Ã¢ÂÂ Power flow equations, and solution methods Ã¢ÂÂ Gauss-Seidel, Newton-Raphson and Fast decoupled load flow algorithms.Faults in Power System Ã¢ÂÂ Short circuits and open circuits. Symmetrical and Unsymmetrical faults. Symmetrical components and sequence networks. Analysis of symmetrical and unsymmetrical faults.Power System Protection Ã¢ÂÂ Protective relays and their characteristics. Overcurrent, distance and differential protection schemes. Circuit breakers.Power System Controls Ã¢ÂÂ Generator voltage control. Turbine-governor control. Load Frequency control. Economic dispatch and optimal power flow.Power System Stability Ã¢ÂÂ Swing equation. Equal area criterion and numerical integration of swing equation.
